instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad issue
threads.message:
Hi Team,
 I have this machine came with No trackpad and keyboard except power button working.
Replaced the trackpad and the flex going to the motherboard,
now the keyboard works fine but the trackpad is acting weird: the center area is like sensitiveless,  also once I had the mouse cursor flickering and moving by itself on the screen.
I've reinstalled the OS, but I still have this centered area not working properly.
I've tryed with a trackpad for a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board (macbook 12 2015 ) that normaly are not compatible, this one had only the left side working properly.
It's very confusing when wanted to order the right Part Number on the net because both models have the same PN.

Now I just would like to know if it's an issue related to my motherboard or just coming from the trackpad itself  which can be  solved by replacing it once more......

regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad issue
threads.message:
Must be trackpad issue.
Cursor movement is decoded in trackpad circitry.
